item.title: Guilty Gear Strive - Season 4 Battle Balance Update Trailer
item.description: Guilty Gear Strive releases season 4, which not only introduces a new character with Queen Dizzy, but a massive update that fixes and balances the entire roster. The latest trailer covers some of the bigger changes coming to season 4 through new gameplay.

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Fans Have Chance to Get Double XP
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Call of Duty is giving away 3 Double XP tokens for Black Ops 6.
  • To get them, fans need to reply to the @CallOfDuty account's latest promo tweet with their Activision ID and the #BlackOps6 hashtag three times.
  • The same offer might also be relaunched tomorrow, the last day before Black Ops 6's October 25 release.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 fans currently have a chance to easily earn up to three Double XP tokens, which provide limited-time boosts for all of the game's experience point categories. The newly introduced promotion is meant to celebrate Black Ops 6 's upcoming release.

The 2024 Call of Duty game has been available to preload since Monday, October 21. Black Ops 6 will release on October 25 across all of its target platforms simultaneously.

Ahead of its market debut, Activision launched a new promotion that allows Call of Duty fans to earn multiple Double XP tokens, which they'll be able to claim in the game at launch. To do so, they need to head to X, formerly Twitter, and reply to the official @CallOfDuty account's new promo tweet with their Activision ID and the #BlackOps6 hashtag. Doing so will earn them a single Double XP token lasting one hour. This process can be repeated up to three times.

How To Get Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Pre-Release Bonuses

  1. Log into Twitter.
  2. Reply to @CallOfDuty's latest promo tweet with your Activision ID and hashtag #BlackOps6 .
  3. Repeat step two up to two more times.
  4. Claim up to three 1-hour Double XP tokens and digital stickers in CoD: Black Ops 6 at launch.

The one-hour Double XP tokens offered as part of the promotion provide boosts for Player XP, Weapon XP, and BattlePass XP, with one of each included. Replying to the promo tweet in the correct format will prompt an automatic response confirming that another in-game reward has been added to one's account, in addition to revealing which one it is. Each response will also include a personalized sticker featuring the marketing campaign's graphic and one's Activision ID. The Call of Duty Twitter account will inform players when they have reached the maximum number of requests, in addition to warning them if their stated ID wasn't found.

Since fans who try sending four or more requests are informed that they have hit their request limit "today," it's possible that this promotion might also return tomorrow, October 24. Activision, for its part, hasn't yet said how long it intends to run it. Tying in-game rewards to multiple replies has done wonders for the post's engagement, with the tweet already being viewed over a million times as of the early afternoon hours ET on October 23, less than two hours after it went live. Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 is also currently running a Little Caesars promo.

Activision is expected to give away many more Black Ops 6 Double XP tokens over the course of the next 12 months. The shooter itself will be the first Call of Duty title to release day-one on Xbox Game Pass, which might help it achieve record-breaking early adopter numbers.

item.title: Factorio: Best Map Seeds For Every Playstyle And Challenge
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Seed: 3560373594 (Beginner Friendly)
    • Island-Like Starting Area With Excellent Chokepoints
  • Seed: 8732819 (Extreme Resource Scarcity)
    • Large Landmass With Spread Out Resources
  • Seed: 905620 (Scarce Resources & Higher Biter Population)
    • Resource Scarce Map & Surrounded By Biter Nests
  • Seed: 2467246624 (Challenges Base Expansion)
    • Extremely Spread Out Resources & Demands Expansion
  • Seed: 166110909 (Large Island & Easy To Defend)
    • Island With Three Tight Chokepoints For Easy Defense
  • Seed: 1234567890 (Ideal For Railworld Setups)
    • Sprawling Landmass With Abundant Resources — Perfect For Trains!
  • Seed: 987654321 (All Resources Close To Spawn)
    • Gain Access To All Resources In Early Game

When starting a new game in Factorio , you must generate a map that closely aligns with your base building ambitions. You can generate a new map by clicking the randomize button. However, each map generated in Factorio is tied to a string of numbers, called seeds . So, if you ever wish to play a fresh game of Factorio on a map you previously enjoyed, all you need to do is input the map seed number, and you're good to go.

However, relying on the randomize button to find a map that suits your factory-building goals can be time-consuming and boring. Instead, having a map seed string handy can help you generate your preferred map every time . So, whether you prefer sprawling resource zones for interrupted factory expansion, or hostile environments to test your survival and military skills, get ready to discover the best selection of map seeds that will enhance your Factorio experience, no matter how you love to play the game.

Seed: 3560373594 (Beginner Friendly)

Island-Like Starting Area With Excellent Chokepoints

This beginner-friendly map will spawn you in an island-like area with all four main resources nearby . There's also large quantities of oil deposits nearby, which can be utilized when expanding your base in mid-game. You also won't have to worry too much about biter attacks as there are only a few small nests nearby, and you can ward them off with gun turrets and walls.

The reason this seed is beginner-friendly is not because it diminishes challenge — it streamlines it. You'll still have to venture into uncharted territories for resources and continue to deal with evolving biters, but the early game is a lot more peaceful.

Seed: 8732819 (Extreme Resource Scarcity)

Large Landmass With Spread Out Resources

This map will test your skills at gathering enough coal to power your early-game hub , and you'll need to actively look for a secondary source of coal to prevent the risk of factory shutdown. This is also true for the rest of your resources, including iron, copper, and stone, but it's the scarcity of coal that will keep you on the edge as the number of mining drills rises and smelting columns expand.

Moreover, exploring the map for additional resource deposits will have you facing the biter challenge along the way, as many of the deposits have biter nests nearby. However, the sprawling open fields make this map perfect for rails. So, well-planned train setups will help you overcome the tight resource challenge.

Seed: 905620 (Scarce Resources & Higher Biter Population)

Resource Scarce Map & Surrounded By Biter Nests

This map seed scatters all resources, and your starting area is surrounded by biter nests. You'll need to skillfully establish early game extraction and smelting setup and prepare for constant biter attacks . Accessing further away resource deposits isn't going to be easy either, as you'll first need to clear out the biter nests and prepare for potential evolution. While you won't have trouble finding oil deposits nearby, they too are surrounded by two large biter nests.

Succeeding on this map requires prioritizing military science and relying on trains to access resources from deposits further away from your starting area.

Seed: 2467246624 (Challenges Base Expansion)

Extremely Spread Out Resources & Demands Expansion

If your goal is to build a mega base but also to test your defensive skills against aggressive biters, this map seed will challenge your ability to defend against recurring biter attacks and resource management skills. In addition to the biter threat, the terrain also features large sections of forests, and you'll need to clear them out to access land for expansion. Clearing out forests means a spike in pollution, and pollution enrages biters.

As you enter the late game and decide to expand your base, the evolved biters will prove to be a tough challenge. However, with sophisticated military science, it's not only possible to overcome the biter threat, but it also gets quite fun.

Seed: 166110909 (Large Island & Easy To Defend)

Island With Three Tight Chokepoints For Easy Defense

This map spawns you in the middle of a large island with decent resource deposits. The island is surrounded by a large water body and only has three narrow passages that connect it to the mainland. Defending these chokepoints with mines and turrets will be sufficient to ward off mid and late-game biter attacks.

The downside to building your factory on this map is that it does not favor expansion, and choosing to expand regardless will inevitably create new openings for the biters to sabotage the base. So, if your goal is to build a compact factory and just launch the rocket, and factory expansion is not on the table, this map seed should offer a pleasant experience.

Seed: 1234567890 (Ideal For Railworld Setups)

Sprawling Landmass With Abundant Resources — Perfect For Trains!

This map seed is ideal for engineers who wish to largely connect their base through railways. The abundance of resource deposits in close proximity allows you to establish railways sooner than one normally does. The landmass is also large enough to expand in the late game or post rocket launch.

While this map seed encourages railway setups, it does not go easy on you when it comes to dealing with biters. Normally, biters don't attack train tracks, but they can attack electric poles, which may disrupt logistics if a train station loses access to power. So, you'll need to plan your railways strategically and defend railway stations with turrets and mines.

Seed: 987654321 (All Resources Close To Spawn)

Gain Access To All Resources In Early Game

It's rare to find a map that presents all the resources close to your initial spawn, but this easy to remember map seed is perfect for players who want to research advanced tech as early as possible. To benefit from the resource spread on this map, you can consider keeping your factory compact and relying on conveyor belts to gather resources.

The abundance of oil reserves also allows you to build multiple pumpjacks to overcome the diminishing nature of oil output. This map seed favors speedrunners, and players who only want to research technologies necessary to launch the rocket, making it ideal for the Space Age DLC.

item.title: Honkai: Star Rail – Scholar Lost In Erudition Relic Guide
item.description:
Honkai: Star rail has versatile DPS mechanics that players can approach during combat. There's a DoT DPS, a Break DPS, and a traditional DPS that relies on stats like ATK and Crit DMG. Of course, as each damage-dealing type has its own system, it also has specific best Relics.

For example, Break DPS characters like Firefly, Boothill, and Rappa work best with the Break Effect stat, whereas typical damage dealers like Acheron, Argenti, and Imbibitor Lunae simply rely on ATK and Crit DMG. Scholar Lost in Erudition in Honkai: Star Rail is a Relic set added in version 2.6 that works best on DPS who focus on Ultimate and Skill DMG.

Scholar Lost in Erudition Relic In Honkai: Star Rail

Set

Effect

2-Piece Bonus

CRIT Rate increases by 8%.

4-Piece Bonus

Increases DMG dealt by Ultimate and Skill by 20%. After using Ultimate, additionally increases the DMG dealt by the next Skill by 25%.

Scholar Lost in Erudition Relic set in Honkai: Star Rail is one of the few Relics that offers an 8% Crit Rate from its 2-piece. On 4-pieces, the Scholar Lost in Erudition Relic set enhances Ultimate and Skill DMG. It grants its wearer a massive 45% extra DMG on their Skill, which can be deadly for some characters.

Sadly, since it specifically enhances Ultimate and Skill, it's not useful for some damage dealers like Imbibitor Lunae and follow-up attack DPS.

Best Characters To Use Scholar Lost in Erudition Relic In Honkai: Star Rail

Many characters can easily work with the Scholar Lost in Erudition Relic set since it buffs Crit Rate and Skill/Ultimate DMG in general. However, Jingliu is one of the best characters to take full advantage of the Relic set.

Jingliu

Jingliu

Ice

Destruction

5-Star

Guides

Build Guide

Level-Up Materials

Team Composition

Best Light Cone

Scholar Lost in Erudition Relic set works perfectly with Jingliu since she heavily relies on her Skill and Ultimate for her DPS. Once Jingliu enters her Spectral Transmigration state, she will gain a new enhanced Skill that will be further buffed by 45% from the Scholar Lost in Erudition Relic set. Not to mention, her Ultimate will also hit harder with that 20% buff. On top of all that, Jingliu needs her Ult to keep herself in her Spectral state, which makes the Scholar Lost in Erudition Relic set even better for her.

Argenti

Argenti

Physical

Erudition

5-Star

Guides

Build Guide

Level-Up Materials

Team Composition

Best Light Cone

Argenti’s entire gameplay revolves around his Ultimate, which immediately makes Scholar Lost in Erudition Relic set a good pick for him. Argenti still suffers from not having a dedicated Relic set that greatly buffs his Ultimate DMG, but for now, the Scholar Lost in Erudition is one of the best Relic sets for Argenti in Honkai: Star Rail .

Seele

Seele

Quantum

Hunt

5-Star

Guides

Build Guide

Level-Up Materials

Team Composition

Best Light Cone

While Seele is not as overpowered as she was when the game was first released, she’s still a good option for the Scholar Lost in Erudition Relic set since she depends on all her Skills to deal damage, especially her Skill and Ult. You can also build the old Hunt units like Sushang and Yanqing with this Relic set, since they’re like Seele, depending on their Skills and Ultimates.

item.title: For Honor - Light of the Guardians Halloween Event Trailer
item.description: For Honor is crossing over with Destiny 2 in the Light of the Guardians Halloween Event, which gives the Centurion and Lawbringer new cosmetic designs inspired by Lord Shaxx and Saint-14 from Bungie's Popular shooter. Alongside other cosmetic items, players can take part in a new game mode which dresses the enemies up as Scorn from Destiny 2.
